subject: p17318449
Findings: The patient is status post median sternotomy and CABG. There is mild cardiomegaly which is unchanged. The mediastinal and hilar contours are relatively stable with tortuosity of the thoracic aorta again noted. There is mild diffuse calcification of the thoracic aorta. Mild pulmonary vascular congestion is slightly increased when compared to the prior study. No focal consolidation, pleural effusion or pneumothorax is identified. There are no acute osseous abnormalities. Degenerative spurring is seen within the left acromioclavicular joint as well as within the thoracic spine.
Impression: Mild pulmonary vascular congestion, slightly worse in the interval.
